title: release tarballs should not extract to the current working directory
body:
Release tarballs should be created with a base directory pertaining to Go, e.g go-release-1.4 or something to this extent that won't run the risk of overwriting overlaping files in the current working dir.

What actually happens when I extract the 1.4 release tarball:
```
$ tar tfz release-branch.go1.4.tar.gz
.gitattributes
.gitignore
.hgignore
.hgtags
AUTHORS
CONTRIBUTORS
LICENSE
PATENTS
README
VERSION
api/
api/README
api/except.txt
api/go1.1.txt
api/go1.2.txt
api/go1.3.txt
api/go1.4.txt
api/go1.txt
api/next.txt
doc/
(...)
```
